name: Access Requests.txt - JIRA Access
description: This section explains the process of gaining access to the Jira issue tracking system used within the organization. It mentions that access is granted through a Single Sign-On (SSO) system, and users can log in to Jira through the Microsoft Apps portal. Initially, after logging in, users may not have access to view or create Jira issues. To obtain access, users need to request it by contacting the IT team through the #tech_it Slack channel and mentioning @officeit. Once the IT team confirms the access, users need to log out and log back in after 30 minutes to gain access to Jira and be able to view and create new issues.
use_cases: Gaining access to Jira issue tracking system
Requesting Jira access from IT team
Logging in to Jira through SSO
Viewing and creating Jira issues
capabilities: Microsoft Apps portal for Jira login
Slack channel for requesting Jira access
IT team approval for granting Jira access
Ability to view and create Jira issues

name: Access Requests.txt - Adding in email groups
description: This section explains the process for a new member of the DBOPS team at Razorpay to get added to the necessary Google/email groups. It mentions two specific email groups (devops.team@razorpay.com and devops@razorpay.com) that the new member needs to be added to. The section provides two methods to achieve this: either by pinging the #tech_it Slack group and tagging @officeit, or by raising a Jira ticket under the 'IT support project' with the option 'Google Group ID' and selecting 'Adding members to Google Groups'.
use_cases: Onboarding a new member to the DBOPS team at Razorpay
Adding a team member to necessary email groups
Requesting access to specific Google/email groups
Utilizing Slack or Jira for IT support requests
capabilities: Raising Jira tickets for IT support
Onboarding process for new team members
IT support for email group management

name: Access Requests.txt - POC Account Access
description: This section explains that Razorpay has a separate AWS account dedicated for conducting Proof of Concept (POC) demonstrations or trials. To gain access to this POC account, a request needs to be submitted through the 'My Access' portal provided by Microsoft. The section provides an example link to a service desk ticket, likely related to requesting POC account access.
use_cases: Conducting Proof of Concept (POC) demonstrations or trials
Accessing a dedicated AWS account for POC purposes
Requesting access to the POC account through the 'My Access' portal

name: Access Requests.txt - Stage Jump Server Access
description: This section explains the process of obtaining access to the stage and production servers through a jump server. It involves raising two Jira tickets, one for obtaining a Duo account and another for bastion (jump server) access. Once approved, the user needs to install the Duo Mobile app on their phone and use the provided QR code to onboard to the Duo service, which is a two-factor authentication system required for accessing the servers.
use_cases: Accessing stage and production servers
Obtaining secure remote access through a jump server
Setting up two-factor authentication (2FA) with Duo Mobile app
Raising Jira tickets for access requests

name: Access Requests.txt - Stage AWS Access
description: This section appears to provide information or instructions related to obtaining temporary access to AWS resources for staging or testing purposes within the Razorpay organization. It includes links to specific tickets or requests (INFRA-490 and INFRA-2176) that may serve as examples or references for the process.
use_cases: Granting temporary AWS access for staging or testing environments
Managing access requests for AWS resources within the organization
Referencing or tracking specific access request tickets or cases

name: Access Requests.txt - Prod AWS Access
description: This section explains the process of requesting access to AWS stage and production environments. For the stage environment, users can request read-only or admin roles through the My Access portal. For the production environment, a DBOPS Jira request needs to be created and approved by the Director of DevOps, along with a background verification confirmation from HR.
use_cases: Requesting access to AWS stage environment
Requesting read-only or admin roles for AWS stage environment
Requesting access to AWS production environment
Obtaining approval and background verification for AWS production access

name: Access Requests.txt - github Access
description: This section outlines the process for obtaining access to Razorpay's GitHub repositories. It explains that after getting approval from the DBOPS team, an INFRA ticket should be raised with the approved DBOPS ticket attached. The DevOps team will then assist in granting production access. To access GitHub, users need to log in via Single Sign-On (SSO). After that, the DevOps team needs to be requested to provide access to the specific repositories.
use_cases: Obtaining access to Razorpay's GitHub repositories
Requesting production access from the DevOps team
Logging into GitHub via SSO
Requesting access to specific repositories from the DevOps team
capabilities: INFRA ticket board for requesting access
DevOps team assistance for production access
